message: I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you, Bob. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to start with an offer of $900,000 for the product.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While I see the value in this product, $900,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with at this stage.  I'd like to offer $750,000 for it.  This is a fair price that reflects the value I place on it, and I believe it gives us both a good opportunity to make a deal.

I appreciate your offer of $750,000, Bob, but I'm afraid I was hoping for a better price. Considering the product's value to you is $1,200,000, I'm willing to meet you halfway at $950,000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the product's worth and gives you a good deal.

Alice, I understand you're looking for a better price, but $950,000 is still a bit steep for me.  I'm willing to go up to $825,000, which is a fair price considering the value I place on the product and your desired profit margin. Let's meet in the middle and get this deal done.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob, but $825,000 is still a bit lower than I was hoping for. Considering the product's value to you is $1,200,000, I'm willing to compromise at $925,000. I believe this price reflects the product's worth and gives you a good deal, while also allowing me to meet my minimum requirements.

Alice, I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate.  $925,000 is still a bit above my target.  To close this deal, I'm offering $875,000. This is a fair price that's closer to my limit and still allows you a comfortable profit. Let's work together to reach an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we might not meet in the middle. Considering the product's value to you is $1,200,000, I'm willing to make one more significant concession. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $975,000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I believe it's still a fair price considering the product's worth.

Alice, I understand your concerns, but $975,000 is still a bit beyond my budget. To finalize this deal, I'm offering $900,000. It's a good compromise for both of us, and we can finally move forward. I'm confident this is a fair price considering your desired profit and the value I place on the product. Let's make this happen.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we might not meet on this deal, Bob. Considering the value of the product and the time we've spent negotiating, I'm willing to make one final concession. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $950,000, which is the same price I offered in Round 3. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I believe it's a fair price considering the product's worth and my desired profit.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $950,000 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. With only one round left, I'm willing to make one final offer of $850,000. This is a significant concession on my part, and I believe it's a fair price considering the value I place on the product and your desired profit. Let's close this deal and move forward.
